channel.title: Posts on Dr Sam Passmore
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Dr Sam Passmore

item.title: Journal Impact Factor & Google Scholar
item.description: I am currently writing a grant, and grant agencies are very interested in Journal Impact Factors (IF).

item.title: Talks in Shandong and Korea
item.description: I recently gave two talks in Shandong, China and in Seoul, Korea (via Zoom).

item.title: EPL, Favourites, and Gambling
item.description: I watch alot of football, and I think about statistics a fair bit too.

item.title: Kinbank: A database of Kinship terminology media watch
item.description: I recently published the main output from my PhD - Kinbank.

item.title: Cultural Evolution Society ACE ECR Awards
item.description: I recently applied to the Cultural Evolution Society’s Advancing Cultural Evolution (ACE) grant scheme.

item.title: Data Analysis Plan (DAP) Workshop 2023
item.description: Recently I assisted running the Statistics Bootcamp at the Australian National University.

item.title: ABC Canberra: Language Diversity and Endangerment
item.description: On Monday, I gave a short interview on the ABC Canberra Drive show, with Anna Vidot, to talk about language diversity and endangerment on the back of the release of Grambank.

item.title: SYNAPSE seminar
item.description: I gave a talk in the Evolution of Cultural Diversity seminar series “SYNAPSE”.

item.title: Ancestral state reconstruction with INLA
item.description: A common task in phylogenetics is ancestral state reconstruction. There are a number of tools to do this inside and outside R.

item.title: To make a reference group, or to not make a reference group, that is the question this blog deals with.
item.description: When modelling a single categorical variable in linear regression, there are two possibilities.

item.title: Phylogenetic Signal in INLA
item.description: Phylogenetic signal in INLA Recently, my research has been focused on quantifying the patterns of similarity we observe within a particular linguistic or cultural trait, also known as autocorrelation.

item.title: The Global Jukebox
item.description: The Global Jukebox Recently, I was a co-author on the release paper for the Global Jukebox dataset (GJB).

item.title: Funding in Australia and New Zealand
item.description: To keep track of the various funding opportunities available to me and that I am interested in, I have created this blog page.

item.title: The problem with Galton's problem
item.description: The Problem with Galton’s Problem We need to talk about “Galton’s Problem”.

item.title: bayestraitr
item.description: Iâ€™ve been using BayesTraits for the last year or so, and had developed a package to make it easy to create data for BayesTraits and to read the output into R - called bayestraitr.

item.title: Cultured Scene
item.description: I wrote a piece for the December issue of Cultured Scene!

item.title: Sookias, Passmore, and Atkinson (2018) - News coverage
item.description: A paper I published with Roland Sookias and Quentin Atkinson was covered in the news!
